triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: Foundation for all AI agent and agentic system technologies discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: Core concept describing autonomous systems that perceive environments and take actions to achieve goals.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: Describes agents that operate independently in environments, central to agentic systems.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Enables agents to learn from data and improve performance without explicit programming.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Key learning paradigm for agents to optimize decision-making through interaction with environments.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Framework for multiple AI agents to collaborate and solve complex problems collectively.

triples.name: Business process automation
triples.relevance: Primary application domain where agentic systems reallocate tasks from humans to AI.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence in healthcare
triples.relevance: Key application area where agents create adaptive treatment plans and support medical decision-making.

triples.name: Supply chain management
triples.relevance: Critical domain where agents predict and address real-time disruptions in supply chains.

triples.name: Automated decision-making
triples.relevance: Central challenge where attribution and accountability issues arise in AI-driven decision processes.

triples.name: Algorithmic bias
triples.relevance: Critical challenge that must be addressed to ensure ethical implementation of agentic systems.

triples.name: Ethics of artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: Framework for addressing governance, accountability, and ethical design of agentic systems.

triples.name: Algorithmic accountability
triples.relevance: Paper proposes transparent accountability mechanisms as essential for responsible agentic system deployment.
